dublin_core.dcvalue: mCARE is an integrated mobile-phone and server-based software system that helps community health workers (CHWs) digitally manage their daily workflow, including systematic pregnancy surveillance, identification and registration of pregnant women, referral and emergency support, and timely and comprehensive essential newborn care.
Community member, CHW, Community member, Government agency
Dr. Alain B. Labrique, Director, Johns Hopkins Global mHealth Initiative; Email: alabriqu@gmail.com
mCare: Enhancing Neonatal Survival in Rural South Asia
Client education and behavior change communication, Data collection and reporting, Electronic health records, Provider work planning and scheduling, Maternal health, Newborn health
